info.name: gosysutil API
info.description: API collection for gosysutil system metrics. All outputs are human-readable and sensible.

request.description: Returns a detailed breakdown of CPU usage percentages (Total, User, System, Idle). The metrics are calculated by sampling CPU activity over a 500ms interval to provide accurate real-time usage.
Returns a list of all physical disks (excluding loop/ram devices) with their cumulative read and write counts since the system started.

Returns memory usage statistics including Total, Used, and Free memory, plus Swap details. Values are formatted in human-readable units (e.g., GB, MB) and include a 'percent_used' field for quick assessment.
Returns traffic statistics (Received and Sent bytes) and packet counts for all network interfaces. Data sizes are automatically scaled to human-friendly units (KB, MB, GB).
Returns a list of all running processes with their PID, name, memory usage (RSS), and the command used to start them.
Returns a comprehensive snapshot of the entire system in a single JSON response, including refined CPU breakdown, memory summary, disk inventory, and network status.
Returns the system load averages for 1, 5, and 15 minute intervals. Useful for understanding system load trends.
Returns the system uptime in seconds and a human-readable formatted string (e.g., '5d 12h 30m').
Returns the top 5 processes sorted by CPU time (user + system ticks). Shows PID, name, CPU time, memory usage, and command.
Returns the top 5 processes sorted by memory usage (RSS). Shows PID, name, memory in human-readable format, and command.
Returns CPU steal time and IO wait percentages. Particularly useful for VPS environments to detect hypervisor resource contention.
Returns socket statistics from /proc/net/sockstat including TCP/UDP connection counts, memory usage, orphans, and TIME_WAIT sockets.
Returns file descriptor usage from /proc/sys/fs/file-nr including allocated, free, max, and usage percentage.
Returns Pressure Stall Information (PSI) for CPU, Memory, and IO from /proc/pressure/*. Shows some/full averages at 10s, 60s, and 300s intervals.
Returns virtual memory statistics from /proc/vmstat including page faults (minor/major), paging in/out, swap activity, OOM kills, and NUMA stats.
Returns SNMP network statistics from /proc/net/snmp including IP/TCP/UDP packet counts, errors, retransmissions, and current connections.
Returns extended network statistics from /proc/net/netstat including TCP syncookies, listen overflows/drops, timeouts, and IP octet counts.
